text: .@NoKidHungry is helping feed kids who aren't getting healthy meals due to school closures. https://www.nokidhungry.org/coronavirus

The major need that hospitals across the country are echoing: PPE supplies and equipment.

COVID is set to spike. There aren’t enough masks, gloves, ventilators, beds, etc to treat people.

Trump needed to order mass production over a week ago to save lives.

He didn’t. https://twitter.com/podsaveamerica/status/1241420998408146946 QT @PodSaveAmerica There it is. Trump admits he has NOT used the Defense Production Act to get companies to produce the amount of protective equipment American health workers desperately need. 

This is a complete failure of leadership. Period .#coronavirus #GetMePPE http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1241420617758306304/pu/img/BCSO9MmjlCtXZ_xk.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1241420617758306304/pu/vid/480x270/1ofpeOhX1M5Gfyzd.mp4?tag=10

Coronavirus doesn’t care if someone is a full-time or part-time worker – or franchisee or contractor. It doesn’t care if someone has accrued enough sick time. Paid leave policies that exclude certain workers leave them with no good options & put everyone at risk.

New Jersey, let's follow @GovMurphy's lead. Please stay at home. It's the best way to #FlattenTheCurve and reduce exposure to #COVID_19. These are difficult circumstances for all of us, but we'll get through this together. https://twitter.com/GovMurphy/status/1241413979366359040 QT @GovMurphy BREAKING: I just signed an Executive Order directing nearly all residents to STAY AT HOME.
 
ALL gatherings are canceled.
 
ALL non-essential retail businesses must indefinitely close their physical stores to the public effective 9:00 p.m. tonight.

$34,927.43.

That is the medical bill an uninsured patient got for being tested and treated for the coronavirus.

This is not the time for obscene profits or price-gouging.

Right now we must make health care free—including for the 30 million uninsured. https://time.com/5806312/coronavirus-treatment-cost/

Heartbreaking. Doug and I are holding @RepDeSaulnier, his family and staff in our hearts right now. Join us in doing the same. https://twitter.com/RepDeSaulnier/status/1241505755758379008 QT @RepDeSaulnier http://pbs.twimg.com/media/ETq2m7oU4AAzCcD.png

Our delivery workers are doing some of the most important jobs in the country right now.

Why the hell aren't they getting the hand sanitizer, protective gear, and paid sick leave they need?

This should not be happening in the United States of America. https://www.nytimes.com/2020/03/21/business/coronavirus-ups-fedex-xpo-workers.html

Back in 2018, I raised my concerns with Secretary @StevenMnuchin1 & other banking regulators about the record levels of risky lending to highly indebted companies. Now on the verge of another economic crisis, regulators haven’t reduced the systemic risks from leveraged lending.

RT @SSWorks Seniors and people with disabilities are especially vulnerable to the #COVID19 pandemic. They need help now so they can afford housing, food, and medicines in this volatile time.

Thank you @SenWarren, @RonWyden, & @SenSchumer for fighting to increase Social Security benefits! https://twitter.com/SenWarren/status/1241392963843915776 QT @SenWarren We can’t leave behind seniors, vets, & people with disabilities during this public health & economic crisis. @SenSchumer, @RonWyden & I are announcing a plan to increase all Social Security checks by $200/month, the biggest benefits boost in nearly 50 yrs. https://www.warren.senate.gov/newsroom/press-releases/schumer-warren-and-wyden-unveil-plan-to-increase-benefits-by-200-per-month-for-all-social-security-beneficiaries

Heartbroken to hear about Airicka who I saw just last month along with her wonderful mother, Ollie. My thoughts are with her family. Airicka dedicated her life to fighting for racial justice & sharing the story of her cousin, Emmett Till—critical work that we must continue. https://twitter.com/KristenClarkeJD/status/1241415109701926912 QT @KristenClarkeJD Airicka Gordon-Taylor, the cousin of Emmett Till has passed away. Airicka dedicated her life to lifting up the legacy of Emmett Till and speaking out against racial violence as the exec. dir. of the Mamie Till Mobley Foundation, @EmmettTillTalks. Incredibly saddened by this news. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/ETpkcqjWoAMhy9I.jpg

RT @nhannahjones At some point we in the media need to really consider why we are running  these press conferences live. If they are providing more disinformation than accurate information, what purpose are we serving? https://twitter.com/ddale8/status/1241423548301955072 QT @ddale8 A reporter reads quotes from doctors who can't get protective masks. Trump touts progress on masks, blames other administrations, and says, "Many doctors -- and I've read many, many doctors -- can't believe the great job that we've done."

This is an outrage. I called for significant investments in tribal and native communities because we’re in the middle of a pandemic and their needs are too often not a priority. They need these funds now more than ever. https://twitter.com/politico/status/1241008134447149056 QT @politico Exclusive: The Trump administration has held up $40 million in aid to Indian country for weeks.

Meanwhile, Indian Health Service officials have admitted to running a “shoestring” operation and struggled to get a handle on hospital capacity.

Gig workers are doing essential work during this crisis. They need and deserve essential benefits like paid sick leave. Good on New York City for considering legislation to mandate paid sick leave for gig workers. https://twitter.com/bradlander/status/1240792083406995456 QT @bradlander App-based workers have become a lifeline in recent days, transporting people & food as social distancing becomes the norm.

But they can't take a single paid sick day if they get sick (even under new federal & state laws).

In NYC, we can change that:

https://www.politico.com/states/new-york/city-hall/story/2020/03/19/lander-presses-for-expedited-paid-sick-leave-law-for-gig-workers-1268182

Airport workers & contractors put themselves at risk by going to work during this crisis, & many don’t receive insurance or sick leave from greedy airline employers. I’m with @SenMarkey: any money these companies get should come with serious long-term changes to help workers. https://twitter.com/SenMarkey/status/1241130158804828168 QT @SenMarkey Providing basic protections for frontline airline employees and contractors during the #Covid_19 crisis is not only a moral obligation, it is a public health imperative to protect a workforce exposed to millions of people each day.
https://www.markey.senate.gov/news/press-releases/senator-markey-leads-colleagues-urging-protections-for-airline-employees-and-contractors-in-coronavirus-economic-stimulus-legislation

Locally-owned hair salons & barber shops, stores, dry-cleaners, you name it—small businesses across Utah are suffering due to #COVID19. I encourage everyone who is able to support the businesses that are so crucial to our economy during this difficult time.

This is a good first step but we have to do more to prevent evictions & protect working people.

Aprendamos esta lección y sigamos luchando x un mundo mejor.

PODEMOS garantizar el cuidado de salud
PODEMOS tratar la vivienda como un derecho 
PODEMOS seguir políticas de descarcelamiento
PODEMOS darle prioridad a políticas extranjeras humanitarias
Podemos.  Podemos.  Podemos.

Una enorme y principal lección que espero aprendamos en este momento:

La resistencia a las políticas revolucionarias nunca fue a causa de la falta de dinero, capacidad, o logística.

Siempre fue a causa del poder y la falta de voluntad política.
Si las evicciones masivas son una crisis ahora,  ¿por qué no lo fue también el más alto % de falta de vivienda desde la Depresión?

Si la especulación de precios en el tratamiento de COVID debería ser criminal, no debería ser lo mismo para la insulina?

Si los alcaldes pueden suspender los arrestos de baja prioridad, ofensas de bajo nivel,  ¿por qué no lo hicieron antes?
Esta bien si anteriormente no viste la extrema urgencia de nuestro cuidado de salud, nuestra vivienda, nuestros salarios, nuestras cárceles entre otras.  Pero espero que no las dejes de ver después.
Es importante que nos demos cuenta que este virus no ha creado nuevos problemas; si no que ha puesto gasolina en las crisis que hemos tenido por mucho tiempo.

El que la gente se vaya a la bancarrota a causa del cuidado de salud & la medicina que necesitan para vivir es bárbaro. 

Siempre lo ha sido.  #MedicareParaTodos #M4A

Necesitamos cubrir ahora mismo 100% de los costos de las personas sin seguro o con poco seguro.

No solamente las facturas del Coronavirus - el enfermarse puede activar un efecto dominó de complicaciones. https://twitter.com/abbyvesoulis/status/1240994625739018253 QT @abbyvesoulis An uninsured COVID-19 patient just got her medical bill: $34,927.43. @abbyabrams has the story. https://time.com/5806312/coronavirus-treatment-cost/

Los miembros del Congreso no deberían ser permitidos de ser dueños de acciones individuales.

Estamos aquí para servir al público, no para especular.  Es alarmante que esto haya sido permitido hasta este punto.
